bugs.title: CVE-2014-6429 CVE-2014-6430 CVE-2014-6431 CVE-2014-6432 wireshark: DOS Sniffer file parser flaw (wnpa-sec-2014-19)

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2014-6429 CVE-2014-6430 CVE-2014-6431 CVE-2014-6432 wireshark: DOS Sniffer file parser flaw (wnpa-sec-2014-19)

long_desc.thetext:
A flaw was reported in Wireshark's DOS Sniffer file parser. It may be possible to make Wireshark crash or execute arbitrary code by convincing someone to read a malformed packet trace file.

This is reported to affect Wireshark versions 1.12.0, and 1.10.0 to 1.10.9. It is fixed in versions 1.12.1 and 1.10.10.

https://bugs.wireshark.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=10461

The version of Wireshark in Red Hat Enterprise Linux 5 and 6 is older than 1.10.x, and should not be affected. The version of Wireshark in Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 is affected.

External References:

https://www.wireshark.org/security/wnpa-sec-2014-19.html

Created wireshark tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1142613]
wireshark-1.10.10-1.fc20 has been pushed to the Fedora 20 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.

upstream fix
------------

https://code.wireshark.org/review/gitweb?p=wireshark.git;a=commit;h=47c592938ba9f0caeacc4c2ccadb370e72f293a2
wireshark-1.12.1-1.fc21 has been pushed to the Fedora 21 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 5

Via RHSA-2014:1677 https://rhn.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2014-1677.html

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 6
  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7

Via RHSA-2014:1676 https://rhn.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2014-1676.html

It was reported that Wireshark's SES dissector could crash. It may be possible to make Wireshark crash by injecting a malformed packet onto the wire or by convincing someone to read a malformed packet trace file.

This is reported to affect Wireshark versions 1.12.0, and 1.10.0 to 1.10.9. It is fixed in versions 1.12.1 and 1.10.10.

https://bugs.wireshark.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=10454

The version of Wireshark in Red Hat Enterprise Linux 5 and 6 is older than 1.10.x, and should not be affected. The version of Wireshark in Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 is affected.

External References:

https://www.wireshark.org/security/wnpa-sec-2014-18.html

bugs.title: CVE-2014-6423 wireshark: MEGACO dissector infinite loop (wnpa-sec-2014-13)

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2014-6423 wireshark: MEGACO dissector infinite loop (wnpa-sec-2014-13)

long_desc.thetext:
An infinite loop issue was discovered in Wireshark's MEGACO dissector. It may be possible to make Wireshark consume an excessive amount of CPU by injecting a malformed packet onto the wire or by convincing someone to read a malformed packet trace file.

This is reported to affect Wireshark versions 1.12.0, and 1.10.0 to 1.10.9. It is fixed in versions 1.12.1 and 1.10.10.

https://bugs.wireshark.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=10333

The version of Wireshark in Red Hat Enterprise Linux 5 and 6 is older than 1.10.x, and should not be affected. The version of Wireshark in Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 is affected.

External References:

https://www.wireshark.org/security/wnpa-sec-2014-13.html

bugs.title: CVE-2014-6430 et.al. applies to F21 version of wireshark too

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2014-6430 et.al. applies to F21 version of wireshark too

long_desc.thetext: Recently, an update to wireshark for F20 was released; bug 1142613.  Unless I misunderstand the CVE, wireshark in F21, 1.12.0 is also vulnerable.  Doesn't that too need to be updated?

Yes. An update for wireshark-1.12.1-1.fc21 has been pushed to testing.

https://admin.fedoraproject.org/updates/wireshark-1.12.1-1.fc21

wireshark-1.12.1-1.fc21 has been submitted as an update for Fedora 21.
https://admin.fedoraproject.org/updates/wireshark-1.12.1-1.fc21

Package wireshark-1.12.1-1.fc21:
* should fix your issue,
* was pushed to the Fedora 21 testing repository,
* should be available at your local mirror within two days.
Update it with:
# su -c 'yum update --enablerepo=updates-testing wireshark-1.12.1-1.fc21'
as soon as you are able to.
Please go to the following url:
https://admin.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2014-12362/wireshark-1.12.1-1.fc21
then log in and leave karma (feedback).
wireshark-1.12.1-1.fc21 has been pushed to the Fedora 21 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.

comments.text: This update has been submitted for testing by phatina.

AutoQA: depcheck test PASSED on x86_64. Result log:
http://autoqa.fedoraproject.org/report/1hp5f (results are informative only)

AutoQA: depcheck test PASSED on i386. Result log:
http://autoqa.fedoraproject.org/report/1hp5h (results are informative only)

This update has been pushed to testing

I haven't tried to actually check that the various CVE:s are fixed.  But it is
the release that the wireshark developers says should fix it, so I trust them.
:-)
